00033 namespace glm{
00034 namespace detail
00035 {
00036         GLM_FUNC_QUALIFIER float overflow()
00037         {
00038                 volatile float f = 1e10;
00039 
00040                 for(int i = 0; i < 10; ++i)     
00041                         f *= f; // this will overflow before the for loop terminates
00042                 return f;
00043         }
00044 
00045         union uif32
00046         {
00047                 GLM_FUNC_QUALIFIER uif32() :
00048                         i(0)
00049                 {}
00050 
00051                 GLM_FUNC_QUALIFIER uif32(float f) :
00052                         f(f)
00053                 {}
00054 
00055                 GLM_FUNC_QUALIFIER uif32(uint32 i) :
00056                         i(i)
00057                 {}
00058 
00059                 float f;
00060                 uint32 i;
00061         };
00062 
00063         GLM_FUNC_QUALIFIER float toFloat32(hdata value)
00064         {
00065                 int s = (value >> 15) & 0x00000001;
00066                 int e = (value >> 10) & 0x0000001f;
00067                 int m =  value        & 0x000003ff;
00068 
00069                 if(e == 0)
00070                 {
00071                         if(m == 0)
00072                         {
00073                                 //
00074                                 // Plus or minus zero
00075                                 //
00076 
00077                                 detail::uif32 result;
00078                                 result.i = (unsigned int)(s << 31);
00079                                 return result.f;
00080                         }
00081                         else
00082                         {
00083                                 //
00084                                 // Denormalized number -- renormalize it
00085                                 //
00086 
00087                                 while(!(m & 0x00000400))
00088                                 {
00089                                         m <<= 1;
00090                                         e -=  1;
00091                                 }
00092 
00093                                 e += 1;
00094                                 m &= ~0x00000400;
00095                         }
00096                 }
00097                 else if(e == 31)
00098                 {
00099                         if(m == 0)
00100                         {
00101                                 //
00102                                 // Positive or negative infinity
00103                                 //
00104 
00105                                 uif32 result;
00106                                 result.i = (unsigned int)((s << 31) | 0x7f800000);
00107                                 return result.f;
00108                         }
00109                         else
00110                         {
00111                                 //
00112                                 // Nan -- preserve sign and significand bits
00113                                 //
00114 
00115                                 uif32 result;
00116                                 result.i = (unsigned int)((s << 31) | 0x7f800000 | (m << 13));
00117                                 return result.f;
00118                         }
00119                 }
00120 
00121                 //
00122                 // Normalized number
00123                 //
00124 
00125                 e = e + (127 - 15);
00126                 m = m << 13;
00127 
00128                 //
00129                 // Assemble s, e and m.
00130                 //
00131 
00132                 uif32 Result;
00133                 Result.i = (unsigned int)((s << 31) | (e << 23) | m);
00134                 return Result.f;
00135         }
00136 
00137         GLM_FUNC_QUALIFIER hdata toFloat16(float const & f)
00138         {
00139                 uif32 Entry;
00140                 Entry.f = f;
00141                 int i = (int)Entry.i;
00142 
00143                 //
00144                 // Our floating point number, f, is represented by the bit
00145                 // pattern in integer i.  Disassemble that bit pattern into
00146                 // the sign, s, the exponent, e, and the significand, m.
00147                 // Shift s into the position where it will go in in the
00148                 // resulting half number.
00149                 // Adjust e, accounting for the different exponent bias
00150                 // of float and half (127 versus 15).
00151                 //
00152 
00153                 int s =  (i >> 16) & 0x00008000;
00154                 int e = ((i >> 23) & 0x000000ff) - (127 - 15);
00155                 int m =   i        & 0x007fffff;
00156 
00157                 //
00158                 // Now reassemble s, e and m into a half:
00159                 //
00160 
00161                 if(e <= 0)
00162                 {
00163                         if(e < -10)
00164                         {
00165                                 //
00166                                 // E is less than -10.  The absolute value of f is
00167                                 // less than half_MIN (f may be a small normalized
00168                                 // float, a denormalized float or a zero).
00169                                 //
00170                                 // We convert f to a half zero.
00171                                 //
00172 
00173                                 return hdata(s);
00174                         }
00175 
00176                         //
00177                         // E is between -10 and 0.  F is a normalized float,
00178                         // whose magnitude is less than __half_NRM_MIN.
00179                         //
00180                         // We convert f to a denormalized half.
00181                         // 
00182 
00183                         m = (m | 0x00800000) >> (1 - e);
00184 
00185                         //
00186                         // Round to nearest, round "0.5" up.
00187                         //
00188                         // Rounding may cause the significand to overflow and make
00189                         // our number normalized.  Because of the way a half's bits
00190                         // are laid out, we don't have to treat this case separately;
00191                         // the code below will handle it correctly.
00192                         // 
00193 
00194                         if(m & 0x00001000) 
00195                                 m += 0x00002000;
00196 
00197                         //
00198                         // Assemble the half from s, e (zero) and m.
00199                         //
00200 
00201                         return hdata(s | (m >> 13));
00202                 }
00203                 else if(e == 0xff - (127 - 15))
00204                 {
00205                         if(m == 0)
00206                         {
00207                                 //
00208                                 // F is an infinity; convert f to a half
00209                                 // infinity with the same sign as f.
00210                                 //
00211 
00212                                 return hdata(s | 0x7c00);
00213                         }
00214                         else
00215                         {
00216                                 //
00217                                 // F is a NAN; we produce a half NAN that preserves
00218                                 // the sign bit and the 10 leftmost bits of the
00219                                 // significand of f, with one exception: If the 10
00220                                 // leftmost bits are all zero, the NAN would turn 
00221                                 // into an infinity, so we have to set at least one
00222                                 // bit in the significand.
00223                                 //
00224 
00225                                 m >>= 13;
00226 
00227                                 return hdata(s | 0x7c00 | m | (m == 0));
00228                         }
00229                 }
00230                 else
00231                 {
00232                         //
00233                         // E is greater than zero.  F is a normalized float.
00234                         // We try to convert f to a normalized half.
00235                         //
00236 
00237                         //
00238                         // Round to nearest, round "0.5" up
00239                         //
00240 
00241                         if(m &  0x00001000)
00242                         {
00243                                 m += 0x00002000;
00244 
00245                                 if(m & 0x00800000)
00246                                 {
00247                                         m =  0;     // overflow in significand,
00248                                         e += 1;     // adjust exponent
00249                                 }
00250                         }
00251 
00252                         //
00253                         // Handle exponent overflow
00254                         //
00255 
00256                         if (e > 30)
00257                         {
00258                                 overflow();        // Cause a hardware floating point overflow;
00259 
00260                                 return hdata(s | 0x7c00);
00261                                 // if this returns, the half becomes an
00262                         }   // infinity with the same sign as f.
00263 
00264                         //
00265                         // Assemble the half from s, e and m.
00266                         //
00267 
00268                         return hdata(s | (e << 10) | (m >> 13));
00269                 }
00270         }
00271 
00272 }//namespace detail
00273 }//namespace glm
